Agency: Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau
Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau

Description: The country's two biggest tobacco companies agreed to improve public access to internal tobacco-industry documents and to pay $6.25 million into a court fund that will go to support the country's largest online collection of tobacco documents. The agreement was part of the landmark case against the country's largest cigarette companies.
In a settlement with the California Attorney General, U.S. Smokeless Tobacco Company agreed to stop distributing free samples on public grounds and pay $171,000 to the state.
